p: Individuals with diabetes may be at increased risk of infections, especially influenza and pneumonia. This is why all people with diabetes are recommended pneumococcal and annual influenza vaccinations [ 3]. In general, it is assumed that this risk can be reduced, though not completely eliminated, through good glycemic control. Data about the incidence of COVID-19 in patients with diabetes are limited at present, but are increasing steadily every week; early reports have identified diabetes and obesity as predictors of higher incidence [ 4â€“ 7]. However, as population testing is still limited, and only in a few countries massive COVID-19 screening has been performed, whether or not diabetes is associated to a higher risk to contract COVID-19 is still unknown. The data currently available come mostly from hospital consultation cohorts (Fig. 2).
